definition[0]: property and money that a woman gives to her husband when they marry in some societies
definition[1]: money which is given by one company to a company it is trying to buy. The dowry is meant to encourage the second company to agree to the arrangement
example[0]: The government has already written off £5 billion worth of debts and thrown in an extra £1.6 billion dowry.
definition[2]: money or valuable gifts that in some cultures the family of a BRIDE gives to her husband when she gets married
